name: OCG Desert Eel
description: This electrothermal-chemical pistol packs a lot of power for its size and weight. As an UPS cannot fit inside a pocket, OmniCorp Desert Eel is a true pocket pistol only for cyborgs with the UPS bionic.
//: Compatible with all OCG 9mm ETC magazines, but using bigger mags nullifies its main advantage.

name: OCG Hand Autocannon
description: Bulky, heavy and intimidating, the Hand Autocannon is the most powerful electrothermal-chemical pistol developed by OmniCorp. It has 2 round burst and automatic fire modes.

name: OCG N9A1 Chaingun
description: OmniCorp biggest "minigun" stands out from the Nanogun with its unique trigger group and very flexible burst limiter. Each setting in its fire selector lever can be further tuned through short or long trigger pulls.

name: OCG O2038H
description: 9mm ETC variant of OmniCorp O2038 SMG. Features more stopping power, recoil, louder gunfire, reduced rate of fire and less rounds per magazine. Utilizes a helical magazine to maximize ammunition capacity.

name: OCG O2038HSD
description: A 9mm ETC version of the O2038SD with a heavier suppressor, developed together with depleted uranium 9x19mm subsonic armor-piercing rounds. When firing such rounds, it is quieter than the O2038SD, but much louder otherwise

name: OCG O9 Electromagnum
description: An electrothermal-chemical revolver from OmniCorp, capable of firing eight 9mm bullets at high velocities. Comparable to a .44 magnum or .460 Rowland revolver in performance, but requires a charged UPS.

name: OCG O9-2 Doublemag
description: A double-barreled yet compact 9mm electrothermal-chemical revolver from OmniCorp. Unlike the .22 DBR, its layout and action allow single shots but impairs accuracy and makes it less reliable.

name: OCG MS400 Mini Sniper
description: Propelling rounds at muzzle velocities expected from rifle cartridges, this highly accurate 9mm electrothermal-chemical rifle from OmniCorp can mostly fulfill the sniper role in urban environments.
//: Longer barrel than any other 9mm ETC firearm. Still somewhat smaller than rifle caliber snipers
With 9mm ETC HAPM, can punch through tank drone armor, but dozens of rounds are required to destroy one. Muzzle velocity somewhere above 1100 and below 2000 m/s

name: OCG MS400SD Boatman
description: This variant of the MS400 Mini Sniper is deadly accurate and "silent" even with hypersonic rounds. A great OmniCorp product for 6'+ tall bald hitmen or zombie apocalypse survivors.

name: OCG Super SMG
description: "Puts the machinegun in submachinegun" - OmniCorp marketing pitch. Compatible with ammo belts, the SSMG is very bulky but can almost match a .223 machinegun's stopping power. Features integrated combined forward grip/bipod unit and a roomy magazine well.
